CC0005.desc: An inter-disciplinary course focused on what it means to live a healthy and fulfilling life. It equips students with practical knowledge and skills to maintain physical and mental health, while promoting self-care, resilience, and wellbeing. Emphasis is placed on collaboration across disciplines, and understanding the link between mental and physical health.

files.desc: Supporting Figma prototype for 2nd Presentation (Healthy Living Portion) - RActive
files.innerHTML: <iframe style="border: 1px solid rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);" width="800" height="600" src="https://embed.figma.com/design/hiWbnOFAR7KPcpiU9cQMwe/CC0005-App?node-id=0-1&embed-host=share" allowfullscreen></iframe>

CC0001.moduleName: Inquiry and Communication in an Interdisciplinary World
CC0001.desc: A foundational inter-disciplinary communication course aimed at improving critical thinking, writing, and oral communication. It encourages idea discovery through writing, and teaches students how to analyze texts, revise effectively, and communicate with clarity and purposeâ€”skills applicable across all disciplines.

files.desc: Canva slides used during graded presentation
Final Assignment Op-Ed - Echoes of the Pioneers: Bukit Brown's Spirit in an Urbanising Singapore

MH1812.desc: A foundational math course introducing key areas of discrete mathematics like number theory, logic, combinatorics, and graph theory. It emphasizes problem-solving and formal reasoning, and is tailored for first-year computer science and engineering students to build strong analytical skills.

files.desc: A summary of all important concepts in Discete Mathematics (MH1812), using Anki flashcards!
A cheatsheet that consists of additional formulas that might be useful for finals!

SC1005.desc: An introductory course on digital circuit design and analysis, focusing on binary variables and logical functions. Students learn both theoretical principles and practical skills necessary for careers in ICT, including areas like computer architecture, digital systems, and microprocessors.

files.desc: A summary of all important concepts in Digital Logic (SC1005), using Anki flashcards!
Mainly touches on combinational circuits, Verilog and Finite State Machines (FSM)

SC1008.desc: This course introduces C and C++ programming, with a focus on system-level and performance-critical applications. It builds foundational skills for embedded systems (using C) and complex software development (using C++), such as in gaming engines, VR applications, web browsers, and blockchain tools. Complements earlier programming knowledge (e.g., Python in SC1003) by emphasizing speed, efficiency, and low-level control.

files.desc: Contains some additional features of C
